feed.title: Category: picks | User group for Viennese rubyists

entry.title: Picks / what the vienna.rb team thinks is worth sharing this week
entry.content:
16/10 Picks!!

In a series on this website we'll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff... you're in for an eclectic mix! So, here's for the twenty-sixth edition:

Andy:
  • Nyan Cat RSpec Formatter - Because... why the hell not?
  • GitHub and Government - Make government better, together.
  • Rubinius X - Introducing a different kind of Ruby.
Floor:
  • Ruby gems gone wrong - On inconsiderate gem naming, wholeheartedly agree.
  • OSS Perks - A listing of tools that are made freely available to open source projects.
  • RuPy - Couldn't make it to this year's RuPy conference? Thank Glob I wrote a recap.

entry.title: Picks / what the vienna.rb team thinks is worth sharing this week
entry.content:
09/10 Picks!!

In a series on this website we'll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff... you're in for an eclectic mix! So, here's for the twenty-fifth edition:

Andy:
  • Boson for kids - The boson explained for children (grownups can watch too).
  • Applicative functors - you probably haven't heard of them - What every hipster should know about Functional Programming (slides).
  • Weird Machines - Lessons in Instruction-less Computation, from the WOOT '13 conference.
Floor:
  • iloveopensource - And I'm not afraid to show it!
  • From Nand to Tetris in 12 Steps - Currently going through this, super interesting.
  • The Legacy of Web Languages - Compared to the web of old, the way we develop sites has altered drastically. Here's how.

entry.title: Picks / what the vienna.rb team thinks is worth sharing this week
entry.content:
02/10 Picks!!

In a series on this website we'll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff... you're in for an eclectic mix! So, here's for the twenty-fourth edition:

Andy:
  • shellcheck - automatically detects problems with sh/bash scripts and commands.
  • joblint - tests tech job specs for issues with sexism, culture, expectations, and recruiter fails.
  • Secret Token - Ruby on Rails Default Token Database detects if a signing token is known somewhere in the Internet, or not.
Floor:
  • sandi_meter - Introducing: a gem which automates scanning your code versus Sandi Metz' rules.
  • GoogleVis - Frontwise sure knows how to visualize the Takedown Requests dataset from Google!
  • RubyConf 2010 - The Road from Ruby Hacker to Entrepreneur (by GitHub's Tom Preston-Werner).

entry.title: Picks / what the vienna.rb team thinks is worth sharing this week
entry.content:
25/9 Picks!!

In a series on this website we'll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff... you're in for an eclectic mix! So, here's for the twenty-third edition:

Andy:
  • explain analyze - A tool for finding a real cause for slow queries.
  • ninjanine - A helpful guide for beginners an Rails Girls participants. Cover terminal usage, some Ruby tricks and hints what to do when you get stuck.
  • git-cal - For the uber nerd that wants to Git everything.
Floor:
  • Eat, sleep, commit - How challenging yourself to contributing to open source every day changes your life... for the better!
  • CODER - A simple way to make web stuff on Raspberry Pi.
  • codosaur.us - Adventures of a dinosaur evolving to meet today's challenges. Or actually: Dave Aronson sharing his thoughts on writing 'good Ruby'.

entry.title: Picks / what the vienna.rb team thinks is worth sharing this week
entry.content:
19/9 Picks!!

In a series on this website we'll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff... you're in for an eclectic mix! So, here's for the twenty-second edition:

Andy:
  • Emacs Redux - Return to the Essence of Text Editing.
  • Explain Shell - Explain what your command line parameters are doing, also see this to use it from your shell.
  • Codewars - Enhance your mind with coding katas.
Floor:
  • git-pissed - git pissed tracks any number of words across your entire git history. And that's hilarious.
  • GitLab - Talking GitLab and open source with Sytse Sijbrandij.
  • Planet Ruby - vienna.rb regular Gerald Bauer doing fun stuff with the pluto gem: pluto.live.
